sentences.english: We'll post an image of the netherwhelp, offspring of the nether drake flying mount, in the near future.
sentences.chinese: 我們將在捎後放出虛空飛龍幼崽的資料。

sentences.english: On the Dragon’s stub-wings the 40mm ROCKET LAUNCHERS open up with a BARRAGE of leaping fire which FLASHES down and
sentences.chinese: 飛龍戰機的短翼上，40毫米火箭發射器一齊開火。

sentences.english: Keep an eye out for Mutalisks roaming the map as well.
It is also a national forest park.
sentences.chinese: 飛龍湖旅遊度假區還是國家級森林公園。

sentences.english: Then the littlest knight, astride his flying dragon, flew home with his pony galloping beneath.
sentences.chinese: 接着小小騎士駕着飛龍返回家鄉，馬駒則在地下飛奔。

sentences.english: It was wrought out of red bronze, and carved with sea-dragons and dragons that have wings.
sentences.chinese: 城門用紅銅鑄成，雕着海龍和飛龍。

sentences.english: Wyverns are encountered alone as often as they are found in an orc rider's presence.
sentences.chinese: 雙足飛龍常獨自來尋找獸人風騎士的存在。

sentences.english: The Caster summons a Wyvern and binds it to his service.
sentences.chinese: 法師召喚一隻雙足飛龍，並使其爲自己服務。

sentences.english: See " From the Dragon and Hippo Kingdoms " for more information.
sentences.chinese: 請閱“來自飛龍和河馬王國”以讀取更多信息。

sentences.english: Westering, the shadow, ravaging, the dragons.
The occupancy of domestic market comes up to more than 30%.
sentences.chinese: “飛龍”牌運動護具，在國內外市場享有很高盛譽。

sentences.english: The Mutalisk can spew forth Glaive Wurms which seek out nearby targets and punish them.
sentences.chinese: 飛龍可以吐出彈射蟲來攻擊附近的目標。

sentences.english: Dragon Tombstone is the crown of Necropolis development, the ultimate goal to strive for.
sentences.chinese: 飛龍墓碑是亡靈發展的巔峯，是奮鬥的終極目標。

sentences.english: Could you tell us about how Muta stacking will work?
sentences.chinese: 你可以告訴我飛龍如何聚堆嗎？

sentences.english: Wurms which seek out nearby targets and punish them.
sentences.chinese: 飛龍可以吐出彈射蟲來攻擊附近的目標。

sentences.english: It is likely they will have one of their own similar transportation systems, perhaps Wyverns .
sentences.chinese: 他們可能會有類似的方法，也許是雙足飛龍。

definition: to soar/to rise high into the air
outstanding people/water and fire (in Daoist writing)
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
male eagle/tercel (male falcon used in falconry)
legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods
kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
flying in pairs/close union as husband and wife/round-trip flight/(slang) threesome
